parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
From kleronomos; heirship, i.e. a patrimony or a possession.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
From the base of basis; a step, i.e. Foot-breath; by implication, a rostrum, i.e. A tribunal.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From epi and the base of aggelos; to announce upon, i.e. to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself.
To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
A possession, holding fast. From katecho; a holding down, i.e. Occupancy.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From speiro; something sown, i.e. Seed; by implication, offspring; specially, a remnant.

word: [even though] he did not yet have
parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Neuter Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
